educations.schoolName: Southern University and Agricultural and Mechanical College at Baton Rouge

headline: DO
summary: Dedicated professional with 10 years of progressive law enforcement experience, knowledge, and education in Criminal Justice seeking a rewarding career opportunity in an organization that offers a tradition of excellence.

defaultPosition.description: Use federal computer data bases such as NCIC, TECS, IAFIS, and finger prints to confirm the identity of individuals arrested or detained; interview individuals to obtain and verify facts; secure sworn statements, affidavits and documentary evidence to be included in case files. Perform initial review of case documentation to determine legal sufficiency for prosecutorial guidelines and reporting findings to senior officers; prepare criminal complaints, developed facts, gathered evidence, and assisted in the preparation of investigative reports in support of possible prosecution and/or civil action in Federal, state and local courts;  Perform duties such as supporting criminal investigations related to alleged or suspected violations of immigration laws, regulations, and policies; performing investigative functions from planning and fact finding to reporting the results of an investigation;  Routinely request and examine all necessary documents (judgment, sentencing, indictments, and stipulation of evidence documents) to determine the disposition of immigration cases. Consult with Office of Chief Counsel in determining the outcome on complex administrative immigration cases.  Prepare successful Expedited Removals (ER), Reinstates, Notice to Appear (NTA) and Claims to U.S. citizenship case files. Conduct legal research to support custody decisions; recommend custody determinations regarding detention of alien.  Perform detention responsibilities assuring detainees care (physical, mental and civil rights); Counsel detainees regarding detention issues and immigration process.
defaultPosition.title: Deportation Officer

positions.description: Use federal computer data bases such as NCIC, TECS, IAFIS, and finger prints to confirm the identity of individuals arrested or detained; interview individuals to obtain and verify facts; secure sworn statements, affidavits and documentary evidence to be included in case files. Perform initial review of case documentation to determine legal sufficiency for prosecutorial guidelines and reporting findings to senior officers; prepare criminal complaints, developed facts, gathered evidence, and assisted in the preparation of investigative reports in support of possible prosecution and/or civil action in Federal, state and local courts;  Perform duties such as supporting criminal investigations related to alleged or suspected violations of immigration laws, regulations, and policies; performing investigative functions from planning and fact finding to reporting the results of an investigation;  Routinely request and examine all necessary documents (judgment, sentencing, indictments, and stipulation of evidence documents) to determine the disposition of immigration cases. Consult with Office of Chief Counsel in determining the outcome on complex administrative immigration cases.  Prepare successful Expedited Removals (ER), Reinstates, Notice to Appear (NTA) and Claims to U.S. citizenship case files. Conduct legal research to support custody decisions; recommend custody determinations regarding detention of alien. positions.title: Deportation Officer

positions.description: Apprehended undocumented aliens from all over the world; process and evaluated incoming intelligence information from a variety of sources and develop trends, patterns, methodologies and tactical interdiction to solve unusual problems.  Identified and located aliens who may pose a threat to national security and/or public safety utilizing various methods and techniques which may include the use of actionable intelligence, use of surveillance systems and agency database systems or participation in the interview of witnesses or interrogation of suspects.   Participated in investigations of immigration cases, presented facts to the appropriate function element or to a United States Attorney for consideration for prosecution. Assisting in the planning, coordination, and execution of the deportation of alien detainees; maintaining control of assigned aliens.   Performed armed escort of detainees from one facility to another ensuring sufficient documentation for transport; supervised and transported detainees (including medical, court and prison pick-ups).
positions.title: Border patrol

positions.description:
Strengthen intergovernmental relationships by working with governors, state agencies, state legislatures, local governments, law enforcement and non-government agencies, and border-community partners; engaged in a visible outreach process that obtains the views of local governments, law enforcement, non-government agencies, and border-community partners concerned with border security.
 
Accomplishments

Developed and wrote the Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) for Border Patrol Awareness Program (B.P.A.P.). The B.P.A.P. is a program devoted to informing and educating various communities through public outreach aimed at effectively translating the Border Patrol mission.

Supervised five consecutive Rewarding, Education, Attitude and Leadership (R.E.A.L.) Mission classes. 

The R.E.A.L. Mission program was designed by Laredo Sector Border Patrol to help high school students with behavioral and drug abuse problems. Students were appointed to the program by a local judge to attend the six week program.
positions.title: Border Community Liaison/Congressional Liaison

positions.description: Served on a tactical team as a Squad Automatic Weapon (S.A.W.) Gunner.  The tactical team duties were to protect the nationâs federal oil reserve and nuclear plant sites from terrorist attacks. Gained a Top Secret clearance, became a certified Humvee operator, and a proficient marksman. Received extensive training at Kirkland Air Force Base in Albuquerque, New Mexico in firearms, building clearance, defensive driving, ambush defense, and field tactical movements.
positions.title: Security Police Officer
